definition: five chief demons of folklore personifying pestilence/also written 五瘟神
ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations
Five ghosts mock the judge, or Five ghosts resist judgment (title of folk opera, idiom); important personage mobbed by a crowd of ne'er-do-wells
to terminate/to cut short/to bring to a stop/to squeeze/to tighten/to damage/variant of 殺|杀[sha1]
White Tiger (the seven mansions of the west sky)/(slang) hairless female genitalia
five chief demons of folklore personifying pestilence

talisman in the form of a painting of symbols thought to have magical powers (also called 符籙|符箓[fu2 lu4])/to invoke the magical power of such a talisman/a tiger tally 虎符[hu3 fu2] sent with great urgency
to vent one's anger on (an innocent party)/to take it out on (sb)
baleful look/inauspicious influence/(of a tire, balloon etc) to leak air

four divinities/four divine emperors/four mythical creatures symbolic of prosperity and longevity, namely the phoenix 鳳|凤[feng4], turtle 龜|龟[gui1], dragon 龍|龙[long2] and Chinese unicorn 麒麟[qi2 lin2]/also 四象[si4 xiang4], the four division of the sky
